docs.lead_paragraph: A federal district judge reinforces that the health reform law was designed to provide quality, affordable health care for “all” Americans.

headline.main: Health Care Reform Survives a Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Health Care Reform Survives a Lawsuit

docs.abstract: Editorial welcomes decision by federal Judge Paul Friedman to dismiss lawsuit filed against the health care reform law; contends decision deserves to be upheld.
docs.snippet: A federal district judge reinforces that the health reform law was designed to provide quality, affordable health care for “all” Americans.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Enacting a plan that would close tax loopholes and lower rates, while raising needed federal revenue, would not be easy. But recent work by congressional committees raises some tantalizing possibilities.

headline.main: Window Is Opening for Change in Tax Code
headline.print_headline: Window Is Opening for Change in Tax Code

docs.abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column notes that, despite partisanship and gridlock in Congress, behind-the-scenes work by congressional committees is raising real possibilities for overhaul of the tax code.
docs.snippet: Enacting a plan that would close tax loopholes and lower rates, while raising needed federal revenue, would not be easy. But recent work by congressional committees raises some tantalizing possibilities.

docs.lead_paragraph: Prosecutors, working independently of politicians, are pursuing corruption cases against a widening pool of current and former officials and members of the business elite.

headline.main: In Greece, Elites Are Starting to Feel the Pain
headline.print_headline: In Greece, Elites Are Starting To to Feel the Pain

docs.snippet: Prosecutors, working independently of politicians, are pursuing corruption cases against a widening pool of current and former officials and members of the business elite.

docs.lead_paragraph: Houston Mayor Annise Parker has married longtime partner Kathy Hubbard in a sunset ceremony Thursday at a private residence in Palm Springs, Calif., Parker's office announced.

headline.print_headline: Houston Mayor Weds Longtime Partner in California

docs.lead_paragraph: Washington's battles over government funding ended with a whimper on Thursday as the U.S. Senate approved a $1.1 trillion spending bill that quells for nearly nine months the threat of another federal agency shutdown.

headline.main: Senate Approves U.S. Budget Bill, Ends Shutdown Threat
headline.print_headline: Senate Approves U.S. Budget Bill, Ends Shutdown Threat

docs.snippet: Washington's battles over government funding ended with a whimper on Thursday as the U.S. Senate approved a $1.1 trillion spending bill that quells for nearly nine months the threat of another federal agency shutdown.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House on Thursday backed a bill that would require the Obama administration to report weekly on how many Americans have signed up for health care coverage as Republicans maintain an election-year spotlight on the troubled law.

headline.main: House Passes Bill Requiring Health Care Numbers
headline.print_headline: House Passes Bill Requiring Health Care Numbers

docs.snippet: The House on Thursday backed a bill that would require the Obama administration to report weekly on how many Americans have signed up for health care coverage as Republicans maintain an election-year spotlight on the troubled law.

headline.main: Lots of New Patients, Too Few Doctors

docs.abstract: It is increasingly difficult for patients to find doctors and to get appointments with primary care physicians like myself, and it is likely to get worse, not better, as millions more gain health insurance under the Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: It is increasingly difficult for patients to find doctors and to get appointments with primary care physicians like myself, and it is likely to get worse, not better, as millions more gain health insurance under the Affordable Care Act.

docs.lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth Group Inc, the largest U.S. health insurer, on Thursday reported a higher fourth-quarter profit and the addition of 170,000 members, and said 2014 earnings would improve as well.

headline.main: UnitedHealth Says Quarterly Profit Rose, Sees 2014 Growth
headline.print_headline: UnitedHealth Says Quarterly Profit Rose, Sees 2014 Growth

docs.snippet: UnitedHealth Group Inc, the largest U.S. health insurer, on Thursday reported a higher fourth-quarter profit and the addition of 170,000 members, and said 2014 earnings would improve as well.

docs.lead_paragraph: Cybersecurity concerns over President Barack Obama's health care website have been cleared up through testing, a government security professional who initially had qualms about the system assured lawmakers Thursday.

headline.main: Health Care Website Passed Recent Security Test
headline.print_headline: Health Care Website Passed Recent Security Test

docs.snippet: Cybersecurity concerns over President Barack Obama's health care website have been cleared up through testing, a government security professional who initially had qualms about the system assured lawmakers Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate has approved a mammoth bill providing $1.1 trillion for federal agencies this year. The measure fills in details of the budget deal that bipartisan leaders reached last week and the House approved Wednesday.

headline.main: How Congress Divides Up $1.1 Trillion in Spending
headline.print_headline: How Congress Divides Up $1.1 Trillion in Spending
